PHENOXYMETHYLPENICILLIN

PENICILLINS

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Unlicensed use
  • Effect on laboratory tests
  • Profession specific information
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Oral infections, Tonsillitis, Otitis media, Erysipelas, Cellulitis,

By mouth

  • For adults
    500 mg every 6 hours, increased if necessary up to 1 g every 6 hours.
  • For children 1–11 months
    62.5 mg 4 times a day; increased if necessary up to 12.5 mg/kg 4 times a day.
  • For children 1–5 years
    125 mg 4 times a day; increased if necessary up to 12.5 mg/kg 4 times a day.
  • For children 6–11 years
    250 mg 4 times a day; increased if necessary up to 12.5 mg/kg 4 times a day.
  • For children 12–17 years
    500 mg 4 times a day; increased if necessary up to 1 g 4 times a day.

Prevention of recurrence of rheumatic fever,

By mouth

  • For adults
    250 mg twice daily.
  • For children 1 month–5 years
    125 mg twice daily.
  • For children 6–17 years
    250 mg twice daily.

Prevention of secondary case of invasive group A streptococcal infection,

By mouth

  • For adults
    250–500 mg every 6 hours for 10 days.
  • For children 1–11 months
    62.5 mg every 6 hours for 10 days.
  • For children 1–5 years
    125 mg every 6 hours for 10 days.
  • For children 6–11 years
    250 mg every 6 hours for 10 days.
  • For children 12–17 years
    250–500 mg every 6 hours for 10 days.

Prevention of pneumococcal infection in asplenia or in patients with sickle-cell disease,

By mouth

  • For adults
    250 mg twice daily.
  • For children 1–11 months
    62.5 mg twice daily.
  • For children 1–4 years
    125 mg twice daily.
  • For children 5–17 years
    250 mg twice daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Not known to be harmful.

Advice for patients and carers

In children

Medicines for Children leaflet: Penicillin V for bacterial infections

www.medicinesforchildren.org.uk/penicillin-v-for-bacterial-infections

In children

Medicines for Children leaflet: Penicillin V for prevention of pneumococcal infection

www.medicinesforchildren.org.uk/penicillin-v-for-prevention-of-pneumococcal-infection

Unlicensed use

In adults

Phenoxymethylpenicillin doses in the BNF may differ from product literature.

Effect on laboratory tests

False-positive urinary glucose (if tested for reducing substances).

Profession specific information

Dental practitioners

Phenoxymethylpenicillin Tablets may be prescribed.

Phenoxymethylpenicillin Oral Solution may be prescribed.

Prepared medicinal forms of PHENOXYMETHYLPENICILLIN

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: eye drops,
Tablet
Oral solution
